meanings.definition: To persuade or urge someone to do something
meanings.sent1: She cokes her friends to join the study group.
meanings.sent2: The coach cokes the team to give their best effort.
meanings.sent3: He cokes his cat to play with a toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The motivational speaker cokes the audience to reach for their dreams.
meanings.sent5: The teacher cokes the students to participate actively in class.

meanings.definition: A solid fuel made by heating coal in the absence of air
meanings.sent1: The factory uses cokes to power its machinery.
meanings.sent2: Cokes are essential for heating homes in the winter.
meanings.sent3: The miners loaded the cokes onto the train for transport.
meanings.sent4: The blacksmith used cokes to forge the metal into shape.
meanings.sent5: The furnace burned brightly with the help of cokes.

meanings.sent1: She enjoys sipping cokes on a hot summer day.
meanings.sent2: Cokes are popular at parties and gatherings.
meanings.sent3: The vending machine was filled with refreshing cokes.
meanings.sent4: He grabbed a cold can of cokes from the fridge.
meanings.sent5: The bubbles in cokes tickle her nose as she drinks.

meanings.sent1: The chef cokes the meat to enhance its flavor.
meanings.sent2: They decided to coke the vegetables for a unique taste.
meanings.sent3: She cokes the salad with a special dressing.
meanings.sent4: The recipe calls for coking the chicken before grilling.
meanings.sent5: He loves to coke his favorite dish for dinner.
